org.eclipse.symphony.common.topology.ui.viewer
Class TopologyViewer

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.jface.viewers.Viewer
      org.eclipse.symphony.common.topology.ui.viewer.TopologyViewer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener, org.eclipse.jface.viewers.IInputProvider, org.eclipse.jface.viewers.IInputSelectionProvider, org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ISelectionProvider
public class TopologyViewer
extends org.eclipse.jface.viewers.Viewer
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

private  org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.Adapter getModelListener()
           Name: getModelListener Description: Returns the model listener that reacts to the following changes in the model: When the scene centroid is changed ( PresentationTopology.getSceneCentroid()), method updateCentroid() is called. When the scene transformation is changed ( PresentationTopology.getSceneTransformation()), methode updateMouseTransformation() is called. When drag and drop is enabled in the model PresentationTopology.isDragAndDropMode(), method switchDragAndDropMode(boolean) is called. Pre-condition: None. Post-condition: If modelListener was null, modelListener is initialised.

private  void updateAxis()
           Name: updateAxis Description: updates tgRotateAxis according to the rotation component of the mouseTransform node. Pre-condition: mouseTransform != null tgRotateAxis != null Post-condition: tgRotateAxis's rotation component has the same rotation as the mouseTransform rotation component.
private  void updateCentroid()
           Name: updateCentroid Description: updates the scene's centre of rotation sceneCenterTransform with the value returned by PresentationTopology.getSceneCentroid(). Pre-condition: mouseTransform != null model != null sceneCenterTransform != null Post-condition: sceneCenterTransform's value is the value returned by PresentationTopology.getSceneCentroid()

init3DScene

private void init3DScene(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent)
Name:
init3DScene
Description:
initialise the 3D scene
Pre-condition:
none
Post-condition:
The following elements are initialized:
  • universeRoot
  • canvas
  • universe
  • java3dWindow
  • java3DFrame
  • sceneCenterTransform
  • mouseTransform
  • mouseZoom
  • mouseRotation
  • mouseTranslation
  • sceneRoot
  • Lights are placed in the scene by calling setupLights().
  • Mouse picking is enabled by calling setupMousePicking().
  • tgRotateAxis is initialised, displaying a rotating axis in its lower left corner.
The scene looks like:

Parameters:
parent -

getNodeToJava3DObjectMap

private java.util.Map<org.eclipse.symphony.common.topology.Node,J3DTopologyObject> getNodeToJava3DObjectMap()

build3DModel

private void build3DModel()
Name:
build3DModel
Description:
builds the 3d model based on the viewer's input (model). The model is attached to node sceneRoot
Pre-condition:
  • model != null
  • The scene has been initialised by calling method init3DScene(Composite).
Post-condition:
  • model is attached to sceneRoot
  • topologyListener is initialised, listening for changes in the model, modifying the 3D scene accordingly.
  • scene is centerer
  • The scene is centered nominally if no previous mouse transformations are specified
  • Method updateAxis() is called.

updateAxis

private void updateAxis()
Name:
updateAxis
Description:
updates tgRotateAxis according to the rotation component of the mouseTransform node.
Pre-condition:
  • mouseTransform != null
  • tgRotateAxis != null
Post-condition:
tgRotateAxis's rotation component has the same rotation as the mouseTransform rotation component.

updateMouseTransformation

private void updateMouseTransformation()
Name:
updateMouseTransformation
Description:
sets mouseTransform with the value contained in the model (PresentationTopology.getSceneTransformation())
Pre-condition:
  • model != null
  • mouseTransform != null
Post-condition:
mouseTransform has the value contained in PresentationTopology.getSceneTransformation()

updateNominalTransform

private void updateNominalTransform()
Name:
updateNominalTransform
Description:
Computes the scene nominal 'z' distance. This is based on the visible nodes and their x range.
Pre-condition:
  • model != null
  • mouseTransform != null
  • sceneCenterTransform != null
Post-condition:
mouseTransform is shifted along 'z' axis such that the whole scene visible.

build3DModel

private void build3DModel(javax.media.j3d.Group j3dcurrentNode,
                          org.eclipse.symphony.common.topology.Node topoNode)
Name:
build3DModel
Description:
builds the 3d model for the currently visited topology node 'topoNode'. The model is attached to the currently visited node of the scene graph ('j3dcurrentNode').
Pre-condition:
none
Post-condition:
new nodes are attached to 'j3dcurrentNode'

Parameters:
j3dcurrentNode - the node we are currently attaching to in the java3d scene.
topoNode - the currently visited topology node.

setupLights

private void setupLights()
Name:
setupLights
Description:
sets up ligthing in the scene. Two lights are added to the root of the universe (universeRoot):
  1. One white directional light pointing in the '-z' direction, its color if (1.0,1.0,1.0).
  2. One white ambient light
All the lights are all white in order to have the 'real' color of the objects displayed in the scene.
Pre-condition:
universeRoot != null
Post-condition:
universeRoot have the 2 lights described above attached to it.

setupMousePicking

private void setupMousePicking()
Name:
setupMousePicking
Description:
Sets up mouse picking by setting up a PickCanvas an attaching the mouse listeners to the 3D scene display (canvas).
Pre-condition:
  • universeRoot != null
  • canvas != null
Post-condition:
  • pickCanvas is initialized and associated with canvas and universeRoot.
  • mouse listener and mouse motion listener are associated to canvas in order to enable handling mouse event.

mouseClicked

public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Name:
mouseClicked
Description:
handles mouse picking. Mouse picking can have two meanings:
  1. Selecting an object in the scene to view its properties.
  2. Selecting an object in the scene to move it, when in 'drag and drop mode', see Picking objects in a scene for more information on the method used to move objects in the scene.
Pre-condition:
pickCanvas != null
Post-condition:
If drag and drop of an object is enabled, the following occurs:
  • pnpNode is initialised with the associated topology node being picked in the scene.
  • pick and place is set up.
In any case, the following always occur:
  • shapePicked is assigned to the picked object
  • The viewer's selection is changed accordingly by calling Viewer.setSelection(ISelection).

Specified by:
mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
Parameters:
e - mouse event
See Also:
MouseListener.mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent)

public void mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)

mouseExited in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

Specified by:
mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Name:
mouseReleased
Description:
mouse is being released, if we were dragging it, the value of mouseTransform is being assigned to the model's scene transformation.
Pre-condition:
  • model != null
Post-condition:
description

Specified by:
mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
Parameters:
e -

Specified by:
mouseMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

updateCentroid

private void updateCentroid()
Name:
updateCentroid
Description:
updates the scene's centre of rotation sceneCenterTransform with the value returned by PresentationTopology.getSceneCentroid().
Pre-condition:
  • mouseTransform != null
  • model != null
  • sceneCenterTransform != null
Post-condition:
sceneCenterTransform's value is the value returned by PresentationTopology.getSceneCentroid()

getNodeToNodePresentationMap

private java.util.Map<org.eclipse.symphony.common.topology.Node,NodePresentation> getNodeToNodePresentationMap()

getModelListener

private org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.Adapter getModelListener()
Name:
getModelListener
Description:
Returns the model listener that reacts to the following changes in the model:
  • When the scene centroid is changed ( PresentationTopology.getSceneCentroid()), method updateCentroid() is called.
  • When the scene transformation is changed ( PresentationTopology.getSceneTransformation()), methode updateMouseTransformation() is called.
  • When drag and drop is enabled in the model PresentationTopology.isDragAndDropMode(), method switchDragAndDropMode(boolean) is called.
Pre-condition:
None.
Post-condition:
If modelListener was null, modelListener is initialised.

Returns:

switchDragAndDropMode

private void switchDragAndDropMode(boolean enable)
Name:
switchDragAndDropMode
Description:
turns drag and drop mode, the mode to move objects in the scene, on and off. For more information on the method used to implement object drag and drop, follow the following link.
Pre-condition:
  • mouseRotation != null
  • mouseTranslation != null
  • mouseZoom != null
  • mouseTransform != null
  • pnpNode != null
  • pnpGroup != null
Post-condition:
pnpNode's transformation is set to the value of 'T_delta' as described in the following

setEditingDomain

public void setEditingDomain(org.eclipse.emf.edit.domain.EditingDomain editingDomain)

getEditingDomain

public org.eclipse.emf.edit.domain.EditingDomain getEditingDomain()
